page.title: 15FARMING
page.content: {COMMERCIAL SALMON FISHING } There is a very successful salmon fishing station at the mouth of the River Naver. It catches around 3500 salmon per year and these are taken by road and rail for sale in Billingsgate. The fishery is controlled by the landlords on the banks of the river, and the only locals who benefit are a few casual employees who work there for a few weeks each summer. However, there is also some unofficial netting on the river.{LOCH FISHING }The numerous lochs in the surrounding hills are full of brown trout. Local hotels own the rights to some of those but in practise they are open to all. Bettyhill is an excellent place for a fishing holiday. The local lobster fishermen will occasionally take visitors on sea angling trips.
